Class SolitaireDemo

  • public class SolitaireDemo
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the entry program of this Solitaire Game

      • prepareGame

        public static SolitaireGameCards prepareGame(SolitaireGameCards game)
        Distributes the card from the draw_pile to the piles
        Parameters:
        game - the current stacks used by the program, I desperately need this variable because in Java everything is passed by value what I mean by that is that is like for example when main passed the game variable as an argument to this prepareGame method and then suppose in this method the return type is void and I used inside here the statement "game = prepared_game" then soon after the execution of prepareGame ends, leaving the execution back to main then what happens is that back in the main method, game isn't really referenced to variable "prepared_game" but instead to the original variable game instead before the execution of prepareGame. This can be solved by using return statement though, I can only return one variable and hence I grouped the piles as one in the object datatype SolitaireGameCards
        Returns:
        the prepared game

      • newGame

        public static void newGame()

        public static void saveGame()

        public static void loadGame()

      • createSuits

        public static void createSuits(char[] suitschar)

      • assignStacks

        public static void assignStacks(LinkedStack[] piles,
                                LinkedStack[] suit_piles)
        Creates the piles and suit_piles needed by the program and assigns them to grouped_piles
        Parameters:
        piles - the piles to where you can put an arrangement of cards (must be arranged from King to Ace with Ace on the front of all cards))
        suit_piles - the piles to where you can put an arrangement of cards that can make you won the game upon filling each of the four piles by 13 cards from the same suit (must be arranged from Ace to King with Ace on the front of all cards))

      • formStacksInGroup

        public static void formStacksInGroup(DrawPile main_draw_pile,
                                     DrawPile sub_draw_pile,
                                     LinkedStack[] piles,
                                     LinkedStack[] suit_piles)
        Assigns each element in the grouped_piles array with the corresponding pile or suit pile
        Parameters:
        main_draw_pile - the piles to where you can draw the cards
        sub_draw_pile - the pile to where your drawn card/s will go after drawing
        piles - the piles to where you can put an arrangement of cards (must be arranged from King to Ace with Ace on the front of all cards)
        suit_piles - the piles to where you can put an arrangement of cards that can make you won the game upon filling each of the four piles by 13 cards from the same suit (must be arranged from Ace to King with Ace on on the front of all cards)

      • separateStacksInPieces

        public static void separateStacksInPieces(DrawPile[] draw_piles,
                                          LinkedStack[] grouped_piles)
        Creates the stacks needed by the program
        Parameters:
        draw_piles - contains main_draw_pile and sub_draw_pile at index 0 and 1 respectively
        grouped_piles - the only methods in this interface are checkPush() and getKind()

      • deckNumberSetter

        public static DrawPile deckNumberSetter(LinkedStack draw_pile)
        Assigns a deck number for each and every card in the draw_pile and pops the card corresponding to the deck_number entered as one of the method's arguments
        Parameters:
        draw_pile - pile where the program draws its cards from
        Returns:
        the new draw_pile having all its cards assigned to a particular deck number
